results.title: Next door
results.brief_description: Based on a Kurt Vonnegut Jr story. A young boy left home alone while his parents attend a movie overhears an argument bvetween the couple in the house next door. The boy, becoming increasingly disturbed by the dispute, intervenes in an unusual way. Starring James Wood as the father of the young boy.

results.title: A Child's visit to the dentist
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fear of the dentist and all that dentists represent, by following a five-fear-old on her first visit to the dentist. Outlines the function of various people working in the surgery, as well as explaining the purposes of X-ray machines, drills, scrapers, etc.

results.title: Competitive swimming: starts, turns, stroke drills
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct form for all swimming starts - grab start for freestyle, breaststroke and butterfly; correct entry for freestyle, butterfly and breaststroke; relay starts and the backstroke start for both long and short courses. Illustrates all turns, using slow motion and underwater camera, and also shows progressive drills for all strokes.

results.title: The Death of trees: Eucalyptus dieback
results.brief_description: All over Australia trees are dying for reasons not fully understood. Scientists have termed this phenomenon “dieback”. Within Australia a microscopic fungi and certain insects have been isolated as the cause of the massive destruction of jarrah, New England and eucalypt forests. Scientists are now looking at cloning techniques as a method of breeding trees that are genetically resistant to dieback.

results.title: Water management
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Peter Dimond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Comic dramatisation is used to stress the importance of water conservation. Studies Adelaide’s water supply system to explain how and why water should be conserved. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Event of the political party
results.creator_credit: Gwynn Pritchard, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: One of four films in the “Mass communications and society” series forming a case study on British politics and television, shot during the 1976 Labour and Conservative Party conferences held in Blackpool and Brighton respectively. Concentrates on the live broadcasts of the events of each day and reveals the philosophies that guide the broadcasters in their decision making. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Main control
results.creator_credit: Jon Miller, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: The last in a series of films of the ABC’s (American Broadcasting Corporation) television coverage of the 1976 Republican Convention in Kansas City. Covers the climax of the convention from the main control room, showing the ballot for the nomination, beginning as the ABC goes on the air and ending just after Gerald Ford wins the nomination. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mass communications and society: a mirror held up to reality
results.creator_credit: John Miller, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: First in a series of four films shot in Kansas City in August 1976, showing the ABC’s television coverage of the Republican Convention. The key areas are shown and the main figures explain their role and attitude towards the politicians and towards their competitors in the other networks. Also shown are the final editorial briefing and the production meeting, as well as the arrivals and speeches of Ronald Reagan and President ford.

results.title: Thirsty season
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Richard Davis, Laughing Kookaburra Productions and Traffic Accident Research Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the making of a beer commercial. Raises issues about the influence of the mass media on community attitudes, and the way in which this beer advertisement is structured to create preferences for a particular brand.

results.title: Saturday night again
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Richard Davis and Laughing Kookaburra Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at situations that could result in drink-driving, and also looks at the other options available through following the social life of a young Sydney group of friends made up of four males and one female in their late teens to early twenties. Covers willingness to intervene in a drink-driving situation; ability to say “no” to someone who wants to drive when he or she is unfit to do so; and alternative ways of spending an evening socialising without the risk of drink-driving. Features Gia Carrides. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
